intro: Schmaltzia affinis, commonly known as the common schmaltzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Europe and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Schmaltzia affinis is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
